commit_message:
Spelling updates to openstack-security-guide.

Fixes a number of minor spelling issues picked up by running the aspell
en-US dictionary against the guide. Note that although the en-US
dictionary was used I have shied away from fixing issues where the only
cause of issue is en-GB V en-US but rather stuck to what I consider
appear to be clear mistakes.

Change-Id: I0bf73d31edbd0e8c42387716b4358934c78f7306

commit_message:
Enable setting blocksize on volumes.

Currently libvirt assumes volumes to have
a block size of 512 when attaching to an instance.

Some back-ends however support other blocksizes (like 4096),
this change add a check from capabilities for physical and logical
block_size entries and updates volume meta-data appropriately.

This can then be used by nova virt to determine if it should pass in
non-default block_size info.

Existing metadata was chosen for now mostly to limit the impact
of the change and minimize risks as we'd like to backport this
to Grizzly.

Fixes bug: 1196248

Change-Id: Ie66e4f3709c10a319eadbf5a195d4404dcbb6b75

so this is a negative test. We'll update the test later once we
implement bulk delete support.

commit_message:
Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the client.

This patch adds a safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to catch
ConnectionFailure and raise a ConnectionError instead. Future patches will make
the transport catch ConnectionError and handle it correctly instead of
propagating it to the client.

All storage back-end should support this.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I523232a7cefbd00082447403ceb3abada9af6db3

commit_message:
Ensure /var/log/heat/engine.log is owned by heat

If heat-manage db_sync creates the logfile before the
heat engine service then it will be owned by root causing
heat-engine to error.

Fixes bug 1199789

Change-Id: Ib23a0d46ebf354a3293a64215715038497faf5b0

commit_message:
devstack: Add paths specific to XenServer Core

 * XenServer Core keeps its Xapi plugins in a different path to XenServer,
   in order to comply with the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard.

 * XenServer Core mounts devices under /dev/xen/blktap-2 in dom0,
   whereas XenServer mounts them under /dev/sm.

Change-Id: I0a66cd03f000f19c8ff63a8ae4231c00fda88380

subject: Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 21:21:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers

Currently there are a mixture of strategies in the v2 and v3 controllers
for how to get the roles assigned for the scope of the requested
authentication.  This duplicates code, is hard to maintain and in at
least once case (where your only roles on a project are due to a group
membership) is not actually correct (for v2 tokens).

This change does the following:

- Standardizes on using the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()', and its
  domain equivalent, for how roles are obtained to build a token.  This
  was already the case for v3 tokens.  The controllers no longer need
  to get metadata and exract the roles.
- Removes the driver level functuon to 'authorize_for_project' - this now
  handled wihin the controller.  The driver simply supports the user
  authentication.

A nice (and planned for) sideffect of the above is that we no longer
expose the schema of how we store roles outside of the driver - i.e.
nothing outside of the driver has to know about how roles are

commit_message:
Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers

Currently there is a mixture of strategies in the v2 and v3 controllers
for how to get the roles assigned for the scope of the requested
authentication.  This duplicates code, is hard to maintain and in at
least once case (where your only roles on a project are due to a group
membership) is not actually correct (for v2 tokens).

This change does the following:

- Standardizes on using the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()', and its
  domain equivalent, for how roles are obtained to build a token.  This
  was already the case for v3 tokens.  The controllers no longer need
  to get metadata and extract the roles.
- Removes the driver level function to 'authorize_for_project' - this is
  now handled wihin the controller.  The driver simply supports the user
  authentication.

A nice (and planned for) sideffect of the above is that we now hide
the schema of how we store roles within the driver layer - i.e.
nothing outside of the driver (other than any specific-to-implementation
tests) have to know about how roles are stored in the metadata.  This paves
the way for a re-implementation of the grant tables in IceHouse.

This change also fills in missing function definitons in the assignment
driver.

Implements bp authenticate-role-rationalization

Change-Id: I75fc7f5f728649d40ab1c696b33bbcd88ea6edee

[{'created': '2013-06-24 06:53:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the
security groups extension and the corresponding unittests
to the v3 framework.

In v3, the management of security groups will be handled
by the networking service API. However, the dis/association
of security groups with instances still needs to be handled
by Nova. This change removes the security group management
code and ports the dis/association code to v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

commit_message:
Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the
security groups extension and the corresponding unittests
to the v3 framework.

In v3, the management of security groups will be handled
by the networking service API. However, the dis/association
of security groups with instances still needs to be handled
by Nova. This change removes the security group management
code and ports the dis/association code to v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I617eee5660447bc61518b89eed73ce394f7435a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 19:43:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I9cf1fb168283f9c76bac622d20719ac1bf7eb648

commit_message:
Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I9cf1fb168283f9c76bac622d20719ac1bf7eb648

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-01 12:54:53.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': 'Set QPID_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode

When deploying OpenStack in a multi-node configuration,
the Qpid clients need the hostname of the potentially
remote Qpid server in order to permit the necessary RPC
communication between components.

Fixes bug #1196521

Change-Id: Iee3c3747cedea9488ec345e78f8eddbc6e850573
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set QPID_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode

When deploying OpenStack in a multi-node configuration,
the Qpid clients need the hostname of the potentially
remote Qpid server in order to permit the necessary RPC
communication between components.

Fixes bug #1196521

Change-Id: Iee3c3747cedea9488ec345e78f8eddbc6e850573

commit_message:
Add EPEL repository to assumptions.

Added EPEL repository to instructions and modified RDO instruction to
use a consistent approach (using the "release" RPM). Also fixed prompt
which erroneously indicated normal user could write to /etc/yum.repos.d.

Fixes bug 1198273

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/35843

Change-Id: I706b74594212a73aeecd229d2fce7f5244f555b3

subject: Add cover/ to .gitignore
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 05:02:08.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': 'Add cover/ to .gitignore

When we run "tox -e cover" to generate coverage report, testr will make
"cover" directory which contains the same html in "covhtml" made by
"./run_test.sh --coverage".  So, make git ignore this directory.

Change-Id: I829667a1ceb55418a5695545ad543a53f63821ba
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add cover/ to .gitignore

When we run "tox -e cover" to generate coverage report, testr will make
"cover" directory which contains the same html in "covhtml" made by
"./run_test.sh --coverage".  So, make git ignore this directory.

Change-Id: I829667a1ceb55418a5695545ad543a53f63821ba

commit_message:
Add dbapi functions

1. add get_nodes_by_chassis
2. add chassis_list
3. add tests for new dbapi function
4. remove object created in setUp function in test

We need chassis_list when we get /chassis,
and we need get_nodes_by_chassis when we get /chassis/chassis_id/nodes.

I remove object created in setUp function because the object created in
setUp function will always exist in the db util test is over, so the
result of test_chassis_list will be effected by the object created in
setUp.

Change-Id: Ic2a743b764761935f847de0e0cdb0a2ebcec2486

commit_message:
Validation added for missed scale/convert impl

It checks that specified plugin supports scale or convert features
before handling scale/convert requests by checking that this functions
has been overridden in plugin.

Fixes bug #1199072

Change-Id: Ifa39da576fe93ca25c19b8776950c44eb2468176

subject: Load config on every access
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 14:22:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/quantum.rb'], 'message': 'Load config on every access

quantum_conf will currently load the quantum
configuration from quantum.conf during prefetch
which leads to an empty quantum_conf and errors
stating the config file is not complete.

This patch changes quantum_conf to be reloaded
each time it is accessed.

Change-Id: Iff7a1dbb152cb7377f24eb0e51aff5d2224ec107
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Load config on every access

quantum_conf will currently load the quantum
configuration from quantum.conf during prefetch
which leads to an empty quantum_conf and errors
stating the config file is not complete.

This patch changes quantum_conf to be reloaded
each time it is accessed.

Change-Id: Iff7a1dbb152cb7377f24eb0e51aff5d2224ec107

commit_message:
Also accept timeout parameter in FakeMemCache

When fake.cache is set, current master keystoneclient
is setting timeout= parameter instead of time= parameter
in set due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1095730

Change-Id: Ied8ffd6ac9738951d48e74a496a8777928fcc0d9

commit_message:
Basic cleanup for security guide pdf.

This is the result of a pass over the guide to fix some of the conversion
errors and other minor page layout issues in the pdf generation from the
new docbook source.

I also added company affiliation for the authors list.

Fixes: bug #1199516
Change-Id: I5035d790e29ee17d83f3b4966aa08917278a6870

subject: Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 13:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/fedora/root.d/10-fedora-cloud-image'], 'message': 'Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19

Fedora 19 cloud images are available here

  http://download.eng.pnq.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/releases/19/Images/x86_64/

Tested the qcow2 image with

  $ disk-image-create -o fedora-19 fedora \
  -a i386 2>&1 | tee /var/tmp/dib-log-f19.txt

Fixes 1199237

Change-Id: If2fb45bd1d528fb52b9c103b211eaf381834019c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19

Fedora 19 cloud images are available here

  http://download.eng.pnq.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/releases/19/Images/x86_64/

Tested the qcow2 image with

  $ disk-image-create -o fedora-19 fedora \
  -a i386 2>&1 | tee /var/tmp/dib-log-f19.txt

Fixes 1199237

Change-Id: If2fb45bd1d528fb52b9c103b211eaf381834019c

subject: Fix config option network_size typo
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 20:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix config option network_size typo

The option is network_size instead of network_size_size. When
used in a larger cidr addr to create a network with nova-manage,
this config option is used and a NoSuchOptError is thrown.

Fix bug 1190354.

Change-Id: I08d8a525d1d0cb9fd527fb5e75401f81399d1f82
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix config option network_size typo

The option is network_size instead of network_size_size. When
used in a larger cidr addr to create a network with nova-manage,
this config option is used and a NoSuchOptError is thrown.

Fix bug 1190354.

Change-Id: I08d8a525d1d0cb9fd527fb5e75401f81399d1f82

commit_message:
Quantum -> Neutron rename

Rename all paths to neutron, and almost all file entries,
except some of those in the nova.conf template(these have not been
ported to neutron yet).

This does not "Fix" bug 1199443 more accurately it avoids it. But
a rename would eventually be needed in tripleo anyway so doing
this now means we don't need to find/wait for a fix.

Fixes bug 1199443

Change-Id: I5e61fab1d444d90eb2c54ccfeefca5e148d96996

commit_message:
Fix misc issues with os-multinic v3 API extension

Fixes action names for the extension to be consistent with other
extensions

Replaces WebDav UnprocessableEntity return code with BadRequest
when the client body is bad

Cleanup exception handling

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ied433fe6cf93d6724201035120612036dec53283

Add "ExtendedVolumes" API extension

commit_message:
Add interface class for backup drivers

This fix introduces an interface class to define the structure of all backup
drivers. It also renames backup/service to backup/driver.
To be backward compatible a mapping functionality is introduced to map old
backup services to backup drivers.

Implements: blueprint refactor-backup-service

Change-Id: Ic3fca567111f4bd1b221689c73cd5c3bab4a777b

subject: Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 02:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet

Validation of the gateway IP address was taken place even
if the gateway IP was set to None; this was causing an
AddrFormatError exception to be raised by method
'_validate_gw_out_of_pools'. With this change we skip
the validation in case the gateway is set to None.

Fixes bug #1178273

Change-Id: Ib84378a4fd2cefdbbcacce695abbfaf82c647dd3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet

Validation of the gateway IP address was taken place even
if the gateway IP was set to None; this was causing an
AddrFormatError exception to be raised by method
'_validate_gw_out_of_pools'. With this change we skip
the validation in case the gateway is set to None.

Fixes bug #1178273

Change-Id: Ib84378a4fd2cefdbbcacce695abbfaf82c647dd3

make them a bit more stable.

commit_message:
Add custom RPC(Des|S)erializer to common/rpc.py

We need a custom way to serialize / de-serialize some types in the rpc
API. Some of this custom serializations are worth moving to Oslo and
other aren't. Before going down that road, it is worth testing them and
make them a bit more stable.

This patch introduces a serializer and a de-serializer for Glance's RPC
API.

Implements blueprint registry-db-driver

Change-Id: I70c429c65d67cbd7ba09176d5f8e4e8f27270c5b

[{'created': '2013-06-24 15:19:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Port user_data API to v3 Part 1

into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The

commit_message:
Port user_data API to v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If8075f202800f333753aa571fc3acf5b1a9f4880

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to AgentBuild.

Added unique constraint 'uniq_agent_builds0hypervisor0os0architecture0deleted'
('hypervisor', 'os', 'architecture', 'deleted') to AgentBuild model and
migrate sripts. Added new exception `AgentBuildExists`.
Updated agent_build_create(). Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: I6c41378470230a48773da8082b17699b09785051

subject: Ensure that the neutron server is properly monkey patched
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 14:26:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure that the neutron server is properly monkey patched

The legacy 'quantum-server' script will apply the eventlet
monkey patch whereas the new 'neutron-server' entry point
does not.  This prevents the server from properly handling
the REST interface.

Fixes bug #1199383

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-09 18:08:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/server/__init__.py'], 'message': "Ensure that the neutron server is properly monkey patched

The legacy 'quantum-server' script will apply the eventlet
monkey patch whereas the new 'neutron-server' entry point
does not.  This prevents the server from properly handling
the REST interface.

Fixes bug #1199383

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Ensure that the neutron server is properly monkey patched

The legacy 'quantum-server' script will apply the eventlet
monkey patch whereas the new 'neutron-server' entry point
does not.  This prevents the server from properly handling
the REST interface.

Fixes bug #1199383

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82

commit_message:
Some corrections to the steps in the README

Changed chmod to allow read/write for 'other'
Removed instruction to run `./redstack start` as this is handled by
`./redstack install`
Added a reminder to save iptables rules
Added `screen -wipe` step to clean stale screen sessions

commit_message:
Port images metadata functionality to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Note that this functionality will be moved from core to an
extension.  Consensus appears to be that we continue to need this
functionality for v3 because some deployers disable the public
image endpoint due security concerns and whether this will be
fixed in glance for Havana. Deployers can disable this extension
if they do not want it.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I900ff0f93bb790f4f7bbac66bb2437906cb905f5

subject: Allow storage url override for both auth vers.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-29 04:30:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add -R <storage_url> to override used Storage Url.

Adds new option, -R/--storage-url, to bin/swift which can be used to
override the X-Storage-Url returned from the authentication system.
This can be used to bypass a load-balancer to hit a specific proxy
server for testing/debugging purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing a new,
optional kwarg into swiftclient.client.Connection.__init__(),
storage_url_override.

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

commit_message:
Allow storage url override for both auth vers.

When --os-storage-url is specified on the command-line to bin/swift, it
will override the used storage URL regardless of authentication for both
authentication version 1 and version 2.  This can be used to bypass a
load-balancer to hit a specific proxy server for testing/debugging
purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing the
desired storage URL into swiftclient.client.Conection.__init__() via the
os_options keyword argument.  For example:

  conn = Connection(auth_url, user, key, os_options={
    'object_storage_url': 'http://overridden.storage.url/AUTH_foo'})

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

Change-Id: Id2a36ed6abffd65e7762b6beea5bbfc6c036e848

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-03 09:17:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

DB API is an abstraction layer, which is used to make it
possible to switch DB backends easily (though we've got only
SQLAlchemy backend at the moment).

Public methods of DB API should not accept any backend-specific
arguments (i. e. a Session instance, that is an SQLAlchemy entity
to work with DB transactions).

This patch removes 'session' argument from all DB API public methods
(except volume_data_get_for_project() and snapshot_data_get_fro_project(),
which are a bit tricky and will be fixed by another patch).

If a DB API method must be called by another one in the context of a started
transaction, a private method is used. It accepts the same arguments as the
corresponding public method plus one additional argument to pass the transactional
context (in case of SQLAlchemy backend it's a Session instance).

Blueprint: db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Iabe7ea834ec07f6520614de2461b9ad1ab7a7ac2
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-08 14:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/test_quota.py'], 'message': "Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

commit_message:
Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

DB API is an abstraction layer, which is used to make it
possible to switch DB backends easily (though we've got only
SQLAlchemy backend at the moment).

Public methods of DB API should not accept any backend-specific
arguments (i. e. a Session instance, that is an SQLAlchemy entity
to work with DB transactions).

This patch removes 'session' argument from all DB API public methods
(except volume_data_get_for_project() and snapshot_data_get_fro_project(),
which are a bit tricky and will be fixed by another patch).

If a DB API method must be called by another one in the context of a started
transaction, a private method is used. It accepts the same arguments as the
corresponding public method plus one additional argument to pass the transactional
context (in case of SQLAlchemy backend it's a Session instance).

Blueprint: db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Iabe7ea834ec07f6520614de2461b9ad1ab7a7ac2

subject: Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 17:52:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race

A race existed where it was possible two greenthreads to attempt to create a
new info_cache or bw_usage record for a given instance. This would result in a
DBDuplicateEntry exception.

In both of these cases, first-one-wins is an acceptable solution, so we can
swallow the exception safely.

Fixes bug 1199468

Change-Id: Icc81bb013fa9dc142f88adbe4d11cdbd350230cc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race

A race existed where it was possible two greenthreads to attempt to create a
new info_cache or bw_usage record for a given instance. This would result in a
DBDuplicateEntry exception.

In both of these cases, first-one-wins is an acceptable solution, so we can
swallow the exception safely.

Fixes bug 1199468

Change-Id: Icc81bb013fa9dc142f88adbe4d11cdbd350230cc

subject: Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-20 06:15:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles

The original search action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'

It doesn't follow REST principles.

So change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'

This follow the suggestion from
http://www.slideshare.net/apigee/restful-api-design-second-edition#btnNext at 77 pages.

Change-Id: I114868112e0dd719c046853de29df5cfa8dae6b5
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-03 14:13:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_hypervisors.py'], 'message': "Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles

The original search action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'

It doesn't follow REST principles.

So change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'

This follow the suggestion from
http://www.slideshare.net/apigee/restful-api-design-second-edition#btnNext at 77 pages.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I114868112e0dd719c046853de29df5cfa8dae6b5
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles

The original search action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'

It doesn't follow REST principles.

So change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'

This follow the suggestion from
http://www.slideshare.net/apigee/restful-api-design-second-edition#btnNext at 77 pages.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I114868112e0dd719c046853de29df5cfa8dae6b5

commit_message:
Port quota classes extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the quota classes extensions and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Adds quota class id to data returned by update which makes
it consistent with the behaviour of show.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

commit_message:
Allow graph dependencies to be manually provided.

Instead of always automatically finding dependencies
of tasks it would be nice to allow developers to manually
provide them if they want to. Adjust how dependencies are
located due to this alteration + a few test cases for it.

Change-Id: I61027be7c458cd26b163ca58e703dc413735396c

commit_message:
Remove boot-stack dependency on cinder

Cinder is not used in all boot-stack environments, only in the
overcloud. We may want to have separate elements to initialise cinder
in the future, but that is speculative. Right now we only know that we
don't need cinder except when building overcloud images.

This was prompted by bug 1199412 occuring.

Change-Id: Ie7485f741aaef67599fb1fa2da381e23b6cbe805

commit_message:
Use the runner interface as the best task lookup.

Instead of having to examine tasks for requires
or provides or optional properties/attributes, have
the runner class do this instead and then have the
flows which use the runner class just access the known
to exist attributes directly.

Change-Id: I2db4ce5296bdbd50e882f5940572a4c513e73d20

commit_message:
Unify creation/usage of uuids.

Instead of using the name it is likely better to
give the flows a uuid and use that for tracking
purposes rather than using the flow name (which
maybe duplicated). Also unify the usage of the
job tracking id -> uuid as well as adjust the
visibility of said uuids (to be read-only).

Change-Id: I592800bd9e08e3a7bde33ff250a454588324f052

commit_message:
port Deferred_delete API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I43de158d32c03ffa416699e7f6835a7dbcd9e6bd

commit_message:
python3: Fix unicode compatibility python2/python3

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings
more rigorously than python2. So use six.text_type/six.u()
where appropriate

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Handle errors raised by extend volume

Errors or exceptions raised by extend_volume in manage.py aren't handled.
This means the volume status will not be updated to 'error_extending' when an
error is raised during the process.

Fix bug #1199471

Change-Id: I1a76c317be6c340d7e21d97ebd35552493fd3842

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 15:47:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/coverage_ext.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_instance_actions.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_networks.py', 'nova/tests/cells/fakes.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vif.py', 'nova/network/ldapdns.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_server_actions.py', 'nova/tests/virt/test_driver.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quota_classes.py', 'nova/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'nova/cmd/baremetal_manage.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_multiple_nodes.py', 'nova/tests/test_exception.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/db/utils.py', 'tools/lintstack.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/tilera.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_hosts.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/tests/test_flavors.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/views/versions.py', 'nova/tests/fake_ldap.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/aggregates.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/lpar.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/fake.py', 'nova/tests/image/test_fake.py', 'nova/tests/matchers.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_volumes.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/pxe.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/console/vmrc_manager.py', 'nova/quota.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/pool_states.py', 'nova/api/ec2/apirequest.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Optimize some dictionary operations:

1. Remove unnecessary calls to dict.keys(), which creates a new list.
If we don't need the list, just iterate over the dict without
calling keys().

2. When we iterate over a dict's keys and later get the corresponding
value within the loop, instead use iteritems() so that we get the value
when it's already handy, to save an additional hashtable lookup.

Change-Id: Ifa358c6f3d9f8c0ba57466d7ba7d79bb65a152a0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Optimize some dictionary operations:

1. Remove unnecessary calls to dict.keys(), which creates a new list.
If we don't need the list, just iterate over the dict without
calling keys().

2. When we iterate over a dict's keys and later get the corresponding
value within the loop, instead use iteritems() so that we get the value
when it's already handy, to save an additional hashtable lookup.

Change-Id: Ifa358c6f3d9f8c0ba57466d7ba7d79bb65a152a0

commit_message:
Port consoles extension API into v3 part2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the consoles
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework.

commit_message:
Port consoles extension API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I60fd601e28ed69c2597cfc8742b2e17e706e2a1f

commit_message:
Use ccache to cache all compiles between builds.

Many python extensions are built from source each time an image is
built. Repeating these is wasteful, so ccache is employed to eliminate
that waste. A cache dir outside the chroot is used to speed up
subsequent image builds.

Change-Id: Ib73563ddbe5f3be7454bfc54ab91cedb559a1304

subject: Restart keystone in wipe-openstack
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 01:21:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/bin/wipe-openstack'], 'message': 'Restart keystone in wipe-openstack

Fixes bug 1199568

Depending on the timing on first boot if keystone is started
before os-refresh-config then the file /etc/keystone/logging.conf
will not be in place yet. Causing keystone to fail to start, needing
to be started again after os-config-applier is run but before
init-keystone.

After some recent changes, this is now consistently happening on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ifc979bad0ac351794a12ccda2dd97f277b79721b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restart keystone in wipe-openstack

Fixes bug 1199568

Depending on the timing on first boot if keystone is started
before os-refresh-config then the file /etc/keystone/logging.conf
will not be in place yet. Causing keystone to fail to start, needing
to be started again after os-config-applier is run but before
init-keystone.

After some recent changes, this is now consistently happening on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ifc979bad0ac351794a12ccda2dd97f277b79721b

commit_message:
Correct faulty Chef search query

The search returns a Hash, not a list, so we need
to remove the reference to [0] in the memcached_servers
library routine call otherwise you get:

undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass

in chef-client runs.

Change-Id: I479aca833a2eb80fa2baf3e54809b2edaa713b89

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6971, 'name': 'Malini Kamalambal', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7044, 'name': 'Allan Metts', 'email': 'allan.metts@rackspace.com', 'username': 'ametts'}, {'_account_id': 7680, 'name': 'Alex Gaynor', 'email': 'alex.gaynor@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex_gaynor'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-23 08:58:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-05-23 09:05:28.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/storage/mongodb/utils.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/controllers.py', 'marconi/tests/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': 'Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c

subject: Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-22 18:54:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config

The horizon module adds a "Listen" directive to $httpd_listen_config_file,
which was httpd.conf. Since the apache module puts _its_ Listen
directive in ports.conf, there were two Listen directives which
caused httpd to fail to start.

Change-Id: Idaac1b3038a36d1908063b57487951ce8edb5862
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config

The horizon module adds a "Listen" directive to $httpd_listen_config_file,
which was httpd.conf. Since the apache module puts _its_ Listen
directive in ports.conf, there were two Listen directives which
caused httpd to fail to start.

Change-Id: Idaac1b3038a36d1908063b57487951ce8edb5862

commit_message:
Allow forcing the use of requested_networks

Providers may be using network extensions besides `os-networks`. This allows
them to handle requested networks POST data even if `os-networks` is disabled.

Fixes bug 1199442

Change-Id: Ib8ac78dcbe4f7d5a07fb5ea59507b603716d7435

commit_message:
Change default port for savanna api to 8386.

Since 8080 (the current default) is likely to be used
by other things.  Choose a new unassigned port as the
default.

Change-Id: I8bee3d880167e19810d06e7740842e930f06f9fb
Fixes: bug 1199226

commit_message:
Update bootstack-vm to match undercloud.

Also add Makefile stanza to produce overcoud.yaml from bootstack-vm
and nova-compute-group. This should allow independent usage of
nova-compute-group without having to manually update overcloud.

Change-Id: Id2bd20596e6be887b55019fdad31e6b0f4762eb7

commit_message:
Update nova-compute-instance URL.

Heat must download nested stack templates from a static URL. We
have chosen a reasonable default, the official repository for
tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I9f8f1f3d3ec6492cf3891fab4fe793e05e703eb5

commit_message:
Fixed test - segmented upload of file

The manifest file should be empty. Previously, the data were saved into the
manifest file too, which could cause a false positive.
See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_large_objects.html

Made each segment different, not just data*10.

Change-Id: I6f5a10f2836d6c5d881486d29fc5714213ea4dc5

commit_message:
Fix launching of BfV instances

Fixes LP bug #1047568

Don't explicitly set volume size to 0, rather use the default from
nova.compute.api.API._volume_Size (currently 0, too :-) Also expose
properly in the UI.

Change-Id: I94e72a39d81ee8a7ebeebcac950cf7296372ca91

commit_message:
Implementation of a Heat stacks UI.

This change implements a UI to launch, manage and delete Heat stacks.

The launch screens are implemented with a set of chained forms where
the second form is dynamically built from the template in the first step.

A significant portion of this change was derived from
the work Dan Radez <dradez@redhat.com> did on thermal:
https://github.com/steveb/heat-horizon

UX flow revisions and basic test cases by Gabriel Hurley.

Implements blueprint: heat-ui

Change-Id: I294e93bed6da9dd3553e8b4a6a1c09b7c165a555

commit_message:
Allow use of oslo.config-1.2.0a3

See bug #1194807

We add a new dev-requirements.txt file because we don't want anything
not released to pypi to show up with the openstack pypi mirror which
is built from requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt.

Neutron and oslo-incubator already uses oslo.config 1.2.0a2. Nova used
it briefly but we hit an issue.

1.2.0a3 contains a fix for a regression in the registration of the oslo
namespace package, so it doesn't make sense to allow a2.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-31 22:20:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add location specific information to image locations db

This patch adds a column to the image_locations table.  The column
will store location specific information.  As a location is added
to an image there may be some meta data about that information that
needs to be stored with it.  For example, if it is a file:// URL,
information about the NFS server (host name, mount point) would be
needed in order for the URL to be useful.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

commit_message:
Add location specific information to image locations db

This patch adds a column to the image_locations table.  The column
will store location specific information.  As a location is added
to an image there may be some meta data about that information that
needs to be stored with it.  For example, if it is a file:// URL,
information about the NFS server (host name, mount point) would be
needed in order for the URL to be useful.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: I6a96163abc8e4388e84cae2a8952f89d433210ff

Remove endpoint.name attribute from v3 manager (bug 1191152)

This also provides backwards compatible support for any clients that
were specifying a name by handling it through **kwargs.

subject: Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 08:06:09.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/glance_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/glance.rb'], 'message': 'Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready

Just b/c the glance service has started correctly does not
mean the service is actually running. Often, the service
is not operational and attempts to use the glance_image provider
results in connection errors.

This commit inserts code that allows the glance provider to
sleep for 10 seconds and perform a single retry.

The template for the code and tests was borrowed from keystone.

Change-Id: I565f1befea6ec3d2347f8e29c9aa05d5a312a827
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready

Just b/c the glance service has started correctly does not
mean the service is actually running. Often, the service
is not operational and attempts to use the glance_image provider
results in connection errors.

This commit inserts code that allows the glance provider to
sleep for 10 seconds and perform a single retry.

The template for the code and tests was borrowed from keystone.

commit_message:
Allow Keystoneclient 0.3.x

python-keystoneclient recently tagged 0.3.0, which
provides the v3 auth client. Raise upper bound to 0.4.
Also raise lower bound to 0.2.1, which is needed for
keystone (blueprint ec2signer-to-keystoneclient commit).

Change-Id: I8aef60612bc8c6972ec0aa833724d3382f909d97

commit_message:
Revert "docfix apache2 now supports client chunked encodin"

This reverts commit 68cb91097b75a92237bd90caffcd405c3e83cb53

Just so this is not get forgotten in the tree...

We are using daemon mode and chunked is not supported in this mode.

commit_message:
Allow router route update in XML.

Fixes: bug 1198188

Router updates of routes in XML format fails.
This patch fixes that problem. It also executes
unit tests for XML-based requests to update
router routes.

of quantum within the config to neutron.

commit_message:
Export just the volume metadata for the database to be populated

Change I8c01ba3 retrieved the metadata from Cinder, however it did
not format the output correctly resulting in the metadata being lost
between Cinder and Nova.

This patch fixes Bug 1175571 correctly, ensuring that metadata is
transferred from Glance images to Cinder Volumes and on to Nova
instances.

Change-Id: Ie3a688e6bff539e09ec705ed901534f5829cf167

commit_message:
Update cinder root-wrap config

Fixes bug 1197048

Installs link to cinder-rootwrap and uses the
rootwrap filters from cinder repository. Without these
cinder fails to run any rootwrap commands.

Change-Id: Ibf6dc4b8db7909b4b95efdc1c8090391c226e8a7

commit_message:
Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder

Fixes bug 1199412

os-svc-install hasn't yet been installed so can't be used
specifically /opt/stack/venvs hasn't been created and virtualenv
isn't installed.

This commit will fix the problem building a image but bug 1197048
still exists, causing
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh/post-configure.d/72-cinder
to fail.

Change-Id: I3acc2c8b2304933634aeabf869bfed83c6135c9b

commit_message:
Python 3.x compatibility fixes

Mechanical translation of the easy-to-fix Python 2.x->3.x
compatibility issues. Should work with all Python versions
>= 2.6.

Change-Id: I693ff5d72b2db8d9d3a3347f70f22290897e9cff

commit_message:
Make sure periodic cleanup of instances continues on error

If an instance cleanup fails with an exception, no more instances
will be cleaned up. If the failure is permanent, this will block
other instances from being cleaned up for as long as it remains.

Resolves bug 1192712.

Change-Id: Ibdd69817ee0e6d0963637f38a8be3949e6e053ed

commit_message:
Disable describing of instances using deleted tags as filter.

Previously, one could retrieve instances using a deleted tag
filter that was once associated to the instance. The current change
disables describing instances via a deleted tag.

fixes bug #1197242

Change-Id: I2259594643ecdcf32c10c91c6585bd90bb768527

commit_message:
Implement grace period for claimed message lifetimes

This commit adds a grace period to claims such that claimed
messages are guaranteed not to expire before the claim
itself expires, plus an additional "grace" number of
seconds.

This provides fudge room so that when one worker crashes,
an alternate worker has some time to reclaim the orphaned
messages once they are released from the stalled claim.

Change-Id: Id0e194a85e67f20babfb97e441e11703d6bf5563
Implements: blueprint claimed-message-grace

commit_message:
Update kombu dependency to >2.4.7

* Kombu in the Guest needs to be updated to newer version, that
  has support for heartbeats.  The version in apt unfortunately
  does not.
* An additional dependency to the 'six' package is introduced
  by recent updates to oslo rpc

Change-Id: I2cfae4dc67cd7befabfc494222600fabd90bfab8

", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-06-11 10:11:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'List migrations through Admin API

The os-migrations extension exposes endpoint to fetch all migrations.
The migrations can filtered by host and status. If cells are
enabled migrations can be listed for all cells or can be filtered for a
particular cell.

The route for fetching migrations for
a region is - v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations. Filters can be passed as
query parameters -
v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations?host=host1&status=finished&cell_name=Child

DocImpact

commit_message:
List migrations through Admin API

The os-migrations extension exposes endpoint to fetch all migrations.
The migrations can filtered by host and status. If cells are
enabled migrations can be listed for all cells or can be filtered for a
particular cell.

The route for fetching migrations for
a region is - v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations. Filters can be passed as
query parameters -
v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations?host=host1&status=finished&cell_name=Child

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id70dbece344a722b2dc8c593dd340ef747eb43d3
Implements: blueprint list-resizes-through-admin-api

commit_message:
Add policy checking to compute.api.get_all_instance_metadata

Retrieves all the instance metadata and the list of instances, and
then checks the policy for each metadata against the matching instance.

Fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: I5c4542250c784a868c6cb16a21823eab7b98fc63

commit_message:
Port admin-actions API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I11fd86cffb45851006338f8b6d2f87dad3aef467

commit_message:
xenapi: Tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks

 * Rewrite xenhost._run_command and xenstore._run_command to use
   utils.make_subprocess and utils.finish_process
 * Change exception raised by utils.finish_process to retain information
   needed by calls in xenhost and xenstore

Change-Id: Idcdb50bededf0acde92f1774d6752043ba8f97ce
Fixes: bug #1074087

commit_message:
Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: Ie3de2504fe08f751dbf3f06e4973716a51d7e25b

commit_message:
Move mysql_engine option to [database] group

We can not move the remaining db-related options to the [database] group
because they are defined in oslo-incubator.

sqlalchemy/models.py incorrectly sets options as default.
That's why we need to move mysql_engine to [database] group

Fixes: bug #1193499

Change-Id: Ic485fb28279e5ceeed6e21b4dee2a37a9eea6d6c

commit_message:
Ensure flake8 tests run on all api code

We need to exclude the plugins/xenserver directory
because the python2.4 code can't use as in except clauses.
The existing exclude directory accidentally included some
code in nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins and the related
tests. This code is now included in the flake8 tests,
and the current violations have been fixed up.

Fixes bug 1197858

Change-Id: Ib5f1b65d5d793f0f5854e898ca3ce751e43ef233

subject: Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2069, 'name': 'Yufang Zhang', 'email': 'yufang521247@gmail.com', 'username': 'yufang521247'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 3189, 'name': 'Chet Burgess', 'email': 'cfb@metacloud.com', 'username': 'cfb-n'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 07:45:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-06-27 15:06:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

commit_message:
Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c

commit_message:
Xenapi shutdown should return True if vm is shutdown

clean and hard shutdown vm methods return a False if the vm
is currently shutdown. It should return a True, so that its
return value can be used to determine if the vm is shutdown
or not.

Fixes: bug #1195587
Change-Id: I758c43d45b15c3ef231e9eee3ecac620a44db824

commit_message:
Ignore any exceptions from rpc.cleanup().

When shutting down a service, we don't care what exceptions might occur
when doing rpc cleanup, so just ignore them.

Change-Id: I8f12cbb129769f78452ed3cb613f485d4712eaf7

commit_message:
Fix extent size issue when creating thin pool.

The LVM create thin pool rounds up extents, this
change rounds the free space down to an int to avoid
this issue and also cleans up some comments and
code around how PV's are set up and used.

Change-Id: I725aa819c21c38f464595d0146d6640ecd1e6440

commit_message:
port Service API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ia44030ac56cb09e4303900a178194127ae8e9a31

commit_message:
Define behaviour for properties with None values.

Now that Ref and Fn::GetAtt might return None values, behaviour for
properties with None values needs definition.

This change will treat a None value in the following way:
- if there is a default in the schema, that value will be used
- otherwise a default is used depending on the type ('', False, 0, [] {})

Fixes bug: #1192142

Change-Id: I59ae32c1c32b1bfede7d775aa845cd14246040e1

commit_message:
Add ability to specify SolidFire API version

This change is required for future works in the SolidFire driver.
New SolidFire features (such as extend) are only available in
the latest version of the SolidFire API.

Default to '1.0' for backward compatibility. SolidFire still supports
the '1.0' version in its latest release.

Change-Id: I93590ab297d746d65a58f9166d160d0c1d833014

refactors some part of exception handling in create_volume() to make

sure sys.exc_info() is retrieved so that we can log and reraise it;
also we make sure exception be reraised at the end of exception handling
no matter the request is rescheduled or not.

Change-Id: Idce5d06f8be1fb6018012503ec7f844898a21b25

commit_message:
Refactor reschedule in exception handling of volume manager

Previous exception handling has a pitfall that may potentially clear
the sys.exc_info() (by calling SQLalchmey to update db). This patch
refactors some part of exception handling in create_volume() to make
sure sys.exc_info() is retrieved so that we can log and reraise it;
also we make sure exception be reraised at the end of exception handling
no matter the request is rescheduled or not.

As a side effect, we fixed a bug in unittest which didn't provide
correct argument to db API but previously this exception has been wrongly
consumed by volume manager's exception handling (not reraise exception
when request is rescheduled).

fix bug: 1197648

Change-Id: Idce5d06f8be1fb6018012503ec7f844898a21b25

subject: SolidFire API RequestID is useless.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 01:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "SolidFire API RequestID is useless.

The SolidFire API can take an int or a string for a request-id,
when using an int however it needs to actually be a valid int.

The driver currently was doing an int(uuid) which is too large and
as a result get's truncated making it difficult or impossible to track
request-ids.

This patch chanes the generate request-id to form a hash of the uuid so
that it can be tracked.

Fixed bug: 1199198

Change-Id: I38d5e3d189e679678898c329a9fa173a47853d47
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
SolidFire API RequestID is useless.

The SolidFire API can take an int or a string for a request-id,
when using an int however it needs to actually be a valid int.

The driver currently was doing an int(uuid) which is too large and
as a result get's truncated making it difficult or impossible to track
request-ids.

This patch chanes the generate request-id to form a hash of the uuid so
that it can be tracked.

Fixed bug: 1199198

subject: Enforce credentials requirement on stack create/update.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 23:57:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enforce password requirement on stack create/update.

Password needs to be supplied whenever user credentials are stored,
which is during stack create and update.

Some users have been relying on their auth token to perform all heat
operations (as all other openstack services support) however this has
led them to experience obscure errors when wait handles or alarms are
triggered.

Failing early with a clear error message will stop this class of errors.

Fixes bug: #1194303

Change-Id: I3edef3dee843bb06760be6294b798761eba30cb8

commit_message:
Enforce credentials requirement on stack create/update.

Credentials need to be supplied whenever they are stored with the stack,
which is during stack create and update.

Some users have been relying on their auth token to perform all heat
operations (as all other openstack services support) however this has
led them to experience obscure errors when wait handles or alarms are
triggered.

Failing early with a clear error message will stop this class of errors.

Fixes bug: #1194303

Change-Id: I3edef3dee843bb06760be6294b798761eba30cb8

commit_message:
libvirt fix resize/migrates with swap or ephemeral

Fixes bug 1191608

The code was not properly guarding against backing files not
existing with QCOW2 images. As such, get_disk_backing_file() would
return None, then the subsequent call to basename() on None would
cause an exception.

This bug was introduced with the fix for bug 1185588 and commit
6e768363.

Change-Id: I4b1237ddf01b9398bfdc141180260136b36cae5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 11:09:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cache-url/bin/cache-url'], 'message': 'Curl to redo the request (Found 302)

The URL to download the Fedora 19 images is not persistent anymore,
they are now download from http://download.fedoraproject.org where the
request will be redirected to a different location. Passing the -L option
to the curl command will make it redo the request on the new place and
download the image correctly.

Related to bug #1199237

Change-Id: Ib9b9d65734992e2bf1a6888c5f2eb9de366f8204
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Curl to redo the request (Found 302)

The URL to download the Fedora 19 images is not persistent anymore,
they are now download from http://download.fedoraproject.org where the
request will be redirected to a different location. Passing the -L option
to the curl command will make it redo the request on the new place and
download the image correctly.

Related to bug #1199237

Change-Id: Ib9b9d65734992e2bf1a6888c5f2eb9de366f8204

commit_message:
Add support for new release radar tracking

Ignore Low and Undefined blueprints in the active blueprints list,
unless they are already Implemented.
Adjust colors for Essential/High/Medium/Low accordingly.
Fix alignment of past milestones table.

Change-Id: I33c0058b6f827d67340cc8f6077bfa81f07782a2
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/36202
Approved: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>

Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Preserve network order when using ConfigDrive

Pass network_info to be used by InstanceMetadata instead of fetching
it by API and losing originally requested network order. This is
similar to what has been done for "content" where the original data
is lost after the initial call.

This issue only affects the ConfigDrive code path as the original
network_info is used when using file injection.

HyperV and XenApi are still probably affected by the bug but
unaffected by this fix. The fix is the same for these drivers. Simply
pass a network_info and it will be used instead of fetching the
network info by API.

Change-Id: Ie673b725cb47bf491009db99f6cb1258d46b0a69
Fixes: bug #1156844

commit_message:
Use the same logger class in all test cases

tempest.common.log is used by the most test cases,
but not all of them using it.

This change is aims to fix this anomaly.

Change-Id: I45e667fc4a9938605d131585315659930bfedfce

commit_message:
Port extended-availability-zone API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I531a2d2f68a268d44eaef3a5af0a9c799787b188

commit_message:
Allow tenant ID for authentication

Under the Keystone v3 API Tenant names are not necessarily uniques
across Domains for a User, so the client should also allow
authentication by tenant_id

Fixes bug 1196486

Change-Id: I3f385a19c1d3d66f5539f901796bbaa22d315762

In general we probably do want to log these types of errors... but
not as ERRORS. I think log Warning messages are probably more
appropriate here since it would be possible to hit this when

Fixes LP Bug #1190230.

Change-Id: I0383f7e490ddcdfb31a62cd3760102152a8d16d9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Log cms_verify issues as warnings (not errors).

In general we probably do want to log these types of errors... but
not as ERRORS. I think log Warning messages are probably more
appropriate here since it would be possible to hit this when
expired certs are refreshed...

Fixes LP Bug #1190230.

Change-Id: I0383f7e490ddcdfb31a62cd3760102152a8d16d9

commit_message:
Divide dhcp and l3 agent scheduling into separate extensions

Rationale behind this is that some plugins may support only dhcp or l3 agent scheduling.
The patch is nothing more than refactoring. Functionality was not changed.

Fixes bug 1196806

Change-Id: Ie174059adfaed3028bbf65de7bde3497dd9bc664

commit_message:
Use one action both for vnc and spice console in remote-consoles API v3

* To remove redundant actions merging 'get_vnc_console' and
'get_spice_console' into one action 'get_remote_console'.
* Catch 'exception.ConsoleTypeInvalid' explicitly.
* Add decorator 'extensions.expected_errors'.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I47cf83aff6e4c4dd998a310749a7b921caf89612

commit_message:
Allows nova snapshot errors to be passed to glance

Fixes bug 1191115

Patch will check for nova error property and set image to
killed if the current status is queued. This will allow
to differentiate between long running snapshots and error
conditions that can be reported right away via PUT request

Change-Id: Ibb0968f40cc99f0177dc6909ae08767442030472

commit_message:
Rule based access control improvements - attempt 2

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.  This does not impact the current default policy
checking behavior.

Change-Id: I0f2ea9878e8903390159567cf9409d86256a94e8
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvements

subject: Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-23 13:24:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Added ability to extract all in-use nodes from the 'endpoints' target.
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Changed the 'endpoints' target so it returns data from all rings and
added 'service' filter.
Added a 'raw' filter that provides more detail.

Added 'service' filter which allows the user to specify which service(s)
they are interested in.

Example:

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6011/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6012/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6021/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6022/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6031/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6032/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6041/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6042/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object\&raw

commit_message:
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Added ability to extract all in-use nodes from the 'endpoints' target.
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Changed the 'endpoints' target so it returns data from all rings and
added 'service' filter.
Added a 'raw' filter that provides more detail.

Added 'service' filter which allows the user to specify which service(s)
they are interested in.

Example:

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6011/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6012/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6021/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6022/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",

commit_message:
Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: I5efe196c46b12d88c853f8362ebcbf0cc6f1573d

subject: Adds Config Drive Support
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 15:54:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-06-26 19:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e

commit_message:
Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e

commit_message:
Set the correct URLs in the version return data

The URLs advertised in the data returned by keystone's '/' route default
to localhost and is not usable from off-host.  Not that anything in
DevStack uses it (yet).

Change-Id: I049789f568eff48c1abb0678c3ac0ae8a8960c64

commit_message:
Enable configuration of Identity API v3

Note: the value of these *_API_VERSION variables will NOT include
the leading 'v' as the CLI tools do not allow it.

commit_message:
xenapi: cleanup VM Installation

VM installation created a machine with multiple network interfaces. This
is a needless complexity at that point, we only need one interface. This
change removes the complex network interface setup from
install-os-vpx.sh script, so that only one network interface is created,
which is connected to the selected network (management by default). This
change also removes a lot of non-used code from install-os-vpx.sh
Specify the network to be used for ubuntu netinstall with:

    UBUNTU_INST_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME

defaults to $MGT_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME.

This change also includes:
 - use precise as default

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ib0a0a316e849f2c2651305ea657c84820cd2bb3b

commit_message:
Avoid redefining host to none in get_instance_nw_info(...)

The host parameter is required and a part of the method signature.
When it is redefined from kwargs.get('host') the supplied value
gets redefined to None. This removes the redefinition and keeps the
parameter value intact.

Fixes bug #1194178

commit_message:
Work without admin_token_auth middleware

Requests would fail with a 500 Internal Server Error if the
admin_token_auth middleware was removed from the paste pipeline.
The requests would fail because the code assumed that the context
contained an 'is_admin' element, but that element was only in
the context if the admin_token_auth middleware was in the
pipeline.

This change makes it so that if the admin_token_auth middleware
isn't in the paste pipeline requests will not fail with a
500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: Ic064785226ee70ee475d8f72fea3c2ae6971a07f
Fixes: bug 1190708

subject: Orchestration tests to use admin user, demo tenant.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 21:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/clients.py'], 'message': 'Orchestration tests to use admin user, demo tenant.

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin
tenant cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I1e9a541ac46cd50faeb8f59196b6e17e202135c1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Orchestration tests to use admin user, demo tenant.

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin
tenant cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I1e9a541ac46cd50faeb8f59196b6e17e202135c1

commit_message:
Added logic to skip migrations for sqlite databases, as sqlite does not support altering
schema data.

Added non-py Alembic files to packaging process, as they must be present for
migration sprocessing to success in deployed environments.

Modified the version stamping script to stamp versions without need for templated fields to
be preserved, allowing for repeated calls to update scripts automatically. This is
especially useful for development purposes.

Change-Id: I98af79fee8fec3ac131e54035d00ce0a8f855a63

commit_message:
Remove property features from quantum_network

In a previously merged commit: 36144 , the feature implementation
of the quantum_network provider was removed b/c it was determined
to be faulty.

This commit removes the usage of features from the type, so that
properties that depend on those features can still be used.

Change-Id: I32e36d8c1b803dda1dcea5f6ee47a64d1d09d3b8

subject: Remove extension checks for quantum_network.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-08 23:38:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_network/quantum.rb'], 'message': 'Remove extension checks for quantum_network.

 * The extension checks were failing if /etc/quantum/quantum.conf
   did not yet exist, which could easily be the case if quantum
   installation was attempted during the same run as provisioning.
   Since the checks are pointless anyway - the provider and l3
   extensions are essential parts of the quantum api - this change
   removes them.

Change-Id: I872d56b29ee4de8fefcd1e8ee0c0666cacccb533
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove extension checks for quantum_network.

 * The extension checks were failing if /etc/quantum/quantum.conf
   did not yet exist, which could easily be the case if quantum
   installation was attempted during the same run as provisioning.
   Since the checks are pointless anyway - the provider and l3
   extensions are essential parts of the quantum api - this change
   removes them.

Change-Id: I872d56b29ee4de8fefcd1e8ee0c0666cacccb533

commit_message:
Requirements: Remove factory_boy, allow SQLAlchemy 0.7.10

SQLAlchemy 0.7.10 is compatible with SQLAlchemy 0.7.x, so
allow it. Also remove dependency on factory_boy, which
seems to be unused.

Change-Id: Idb6bdf6ba02f2d826e2d11a9e2324f7d0a236a57

commit_message:
Add callbacks for set_global_engine

This adds functionality where a class can monitor for the global
engine changing.

This is useful for a class that caches the global engine and
wants to know when its cached global engine isn't valid anymore.

Part of fix for bug 1179259

Change-Id: I5736a05308c63de9fccb8af7720ddd70530f4270

commit_message:
Set the scenario/img_dir option for tempest.conf

The default value does not work unless devstack is installed in
/opt/stack/new/devstack. This patch changes the img_dir option to point
to the correct install location.

commit_message:
Add option to run stress tests.

This commit adds a new environmental variable to enable running the
tempest stress tests. If DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_STRESS is set to 1
then the stress tests will be run.

Change-Id: I93a99e587eeb5b6624256696c0109293f835b474

commit_message:
Add no locals() for string formatting test

Using locals() for formatting strings is not as clear as explicit
dictionaries and can produce hidden errors during refactoring. locals() are
already being partially removed in nova and cinder. Related to
bug 1171936

Change-Id: I6ef790ebf50d640af62c535952c7a98053869e43

subject: Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-08 21:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/quantumv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_quantumv2.py'], 'message': "Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot

bug 1175211

Using quantum dhcp agent the VM hostname does not
match the DNS name. Quantum writes dnsmasq config
file using the instances ip address with (dots
replaced with dashes) and the dhcp_domain name.
This causes issues on the instance (instance can't
look up it's own hostname).

Changing network/quantumv2/api.py to pass instance
name as port name to quantum port create.
This will provide quantum the ability to lookup
the port name that was set and write the dnsmasq
config file using the port name.

The relevant change in quantum will be in a future
commit.

Change-Id: Ie446ce6e54434b6f49234dd41d83dce3deeb8632
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot

bug 1175211

Using quantum dhcp agent the VM hostname does not
match the DNS name. Quantum writes dnsmasq config
file using the instances ip address with (dots
replaced with dashes) and the dhcp_domain name.
This causes issues on the instance (instance can't
look up it's own hostname).

Changing network/quantumv2/api.py to pass instance
name as port name to quantum port create.
This will provide quantum the ability to lookup
the port name that was set and write the dnsmasq
config file using the port name.

The relevant change in quantum will be in a future
commit.

Change-Id: Ie446ce6e54434b6f49234dd41d83dce3deeb8632
